summary: This document is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York summarizing notes from a call with Dr. Rocchio on October 24, 2021. The call discussed academic literature on grooming, specifically the presence of third parties in the grooming process and delayed disclosure, as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Dr. Rocchio
persons.context: Participated in a call with a federal prosecutor to discuss academic literature on grooming, particularly the role of third parties and delayed disclosure.

persons.context: Author of the email notes summarizing a call with Dr. Rocchio regarding grooming literature for the Epstein case.

connections.description: The prosecutor consulted with Dr. Rocchio, an expert, to gather information on grooming literature relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Call with Dr. Rocchio
events.description: A call between a federal prosecutor and Dr. Rocchio to discuss academic literature on grooming, focusing on the presence of third parties and delayed disclosure.

keyFacts: The prosecution was actively researching the topic of 'grooming' as part of the Epstein investigation in October 2021.
A specific focus of the research was on the 'presence of third parties as part of the grooming process'.
The research also pointed to the Bureau of Justice Statistics regarding 'delayed disclosure' by victims.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
